column4: i have a massive .rar file that needs to be unzipped, unfortunately the default archiver seems to unzip to /tmp first, which does not have enough space to hold it, any ideas how i can unzip it directly to the specified location?
would you know the proper command? :p
I much prefer commandline anyhow, because of recursive switches etc
well this is the first time i've run into trouble with the archiver tool :>
btw, you are sure the commandline one doesn't write to /tmp first right? :p
Hmmm no... I just assumed it doesnt, since it feels faster than using a gui archiver. Try? :p
still looking up an example command hehe
not sure which parameters to use from the man only
unrar e -r /path/to/files/*.rar will extract recursively in the current directory
how do i enter the password?
does the password actually have to be right against the -p? or a space in between?
Dont know, havent unrar'd anything passwordprotected. Try... if it fails, you did it wrong ;)
well i'm having a bit of trouble with my bridge which bridges over the connection that network-manager is attending to
